intro: Saussurea dolichopoda, commonly known as the long-stemmed saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and dark purple to brownish flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas, thriving in cold, arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and sometimes covered with fine hairs, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions. Saussurea dolichopoda is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
